hints.title: Complete Variance Drift Characterization for Cloning
hints.content:
6893: :label: thm-complete-variance-drift
6894: 
6895: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the variance components of the Lyapunov function:
6896: 
6897: **1. Positional Variance (Strong Contraction):**
6898: 
6899: $$
6900: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6901: $$
6902: 
6903: where $\kappa_x > 0$ is $N$-independent (from Keystone Principle).
6904: 
6905: **2. Velocity Variance (Bounded Expansion):**
6906: 
6907: $$
6908: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6909: $$
6910: 
6911: where $C_v < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
6912: 
6913: **3. Total Internal Variance:**
6914: 
6915: $$
6916: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6917: $$

hints.label: proof-thm-complete-variance-drift
hints.content:
6922: :::{prf:proof}
6923: :label: proof-thm-complete-variance-drift
6924: **Proof.**
6925: 
6926: This result follows immediately by combining the two component drift inequalities established earlier in this chapter.
6927: 
6928: From {prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction` (Theorem 10.3.1), we have:
6929: 
6930: $$
6931: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6932: $$
6933: 
6934: From {prf:ref}`thm-bounded-velocity-expansion-cloning` (Theorem 10.4.1), we have:
6935: 
6936: $$
6937: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6938: $$
6939: 
6940: By linearity of expectation, the total internal variance drift is:
6941: 
6942: $$
6943: \begin{aligned}
6944: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x} + \Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \\
6945: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \\
6946: &\leq (-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x) + C_v \\
6947: &= -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6948: \end{aligned}
6949: $$
6950: 
6951: This establishes the claimed drift inequality for the total variance.

hints.label: rem-drift-constants-dependencies
hints.title: Constants and Parameter Dependencies
hints.content:
6979: :label: rem-drift-constants-dependencies
6980: 
6981: The drift constants have the following dependencies:
6982: 
6983: **Contraction rate $\kappa_x$:**
6984: - Increases with measurement quality (larger $\epsilon$ → better diversity detection)
6985: - Increases with cloning responsiveness (larger $p_{\max}$ and smaller $\varepsilon_{\text{clone}}$)
6986: - Independent of $N$ (N-uniformity from Keystone)
6987: 
6988: **Expansion bound $C_v$:**
6989: - Increases with $V_{\max}^2$ (larger velocity domain)
6990: - Increases with $\alpha_{\text{restitution}}$ (more elastic collisions)
6991: - Decreases toward zero as $\alpha_{\text{restitution}} \to 0$ (perfectly inelastic)
6992: - Independent of $N$
